interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Mafia! [DVD]
Review Date: 2014/07/14
Store: Jay Mohr  (Actor),     Christina Applegate  (Actor),     Jim Abrahams  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
Product Description: ['Product description', 'MAFIA!', 'Amazon.com', 'This hapless comedy may actually work a lot better on video than it did in theaters. A parody of contemporary mob movies (with a few sidebars skewering such hits as', 'Forrest Gump', 'and', 'The English Patient', '),', 'Mafia!', 'most closely resembles the first two', 'Godfather', 'films in its generational saga of a gangster family. Lloyd Bridges plays Don Cortino, a native Sicilian who presides over a crime syndicate, and Jay Mohr plays his Michael Corleone-like son. The film is by Jim Abrahams, formerly of the Zucker-Abrahams-Zucker directing team (', 'Airplane!', ',', 'The Naked Gun', '), single- handedly trotting out the old dumb-joke aesthetic that worked wonderfully a lifetime ago but looks a little creaky in the era of', "There's Something About Mary", '. Silly allusions to every crime film (', 'GoodFellas', ',', 'Casino', ') produced in the last three decades and featuring at least one wise guy or made man find their way into', 'Mafia!', "'s gags, but most are arbitrary and shrugged off. The film tanked in theaters for good reason; on the other hand,", 'Mafia!', "might have a lot more to offer if you're slumped on your own couch at the end of a long day, ready for brain-dead entertainment and absolutely apathetic about comic integrity. Even a film this instantly stale on the big screen might have its place in video posterity.", '-- Tom Keogh']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, Widescreen, NTSC, Letterboxed', 'Contributor': 'Tony Lo Bianco, Michael McManus, Blake Hammond, Philip Suriano, Christina Applegate, Billy Burke, Pamela Gidley, Vincent Pastore, Jason Fuchs, Lloyd Bridges, Joe Viterelli, Jim Abrahams, Olympia Dukakis, Greg Norberg, Jay MohrTony Lo Bianco, Michael McManus, Blake Hammond, Philip Suriano, Christina Applegate, Billy Burke, Pamela Gidley, Vincent Pastore, Jason Fuchs, Lloyd Bridges, Joe Viterelli, Jim Abrahams, Olympia Dukakis, Greg Norberg, Jay Mohr  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 23 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.38 x 0.6 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Jim Abrahams', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DVD, Widescreen, NTSC, Letterboxed', 'Run time': '1 hour and 23 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 9, 1999', 'Actors': 'Jay Mohr, Christina Applegate, Lloyd Bridges, Billy Burke, Pamela Gidley', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Video / Mill Creek', 'Writers': 'Greg Norberg, Jim Abrahams, Michael McManus', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: My Husband love's it.
Review Title: Five Stars
Rating: 5.0

reference_summary:
John Deere Heaven, Part 1
John Deere Toys & Tractors  (Actor),     Tom McComas  (Director),     Joseph Stachler  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Kids & Family
['Product Description', 'Welcome to John Deere Heaven -where all is mellow and even the cows are green and yellow. We first visited John Deere Heaven in All About John Deere Part 4, and people enjoyed the trip so much we decided to return and stay for an entire show.', 'See John Deere toys come alive in this fanciful, fast-paced mix of toy trains, tractors, and big machines. TMs video magic will thrill and delight young and old alike. See O gauge and Standard gauge John Deere trains zip around elaborately detailed train layouts along with John Deere 1/16th, 1/50th and 1/64th scale tractors, cars, and trucks. Plus ten original songs by our favorite singer/songwriter James Coffey. Otto is in town and his little switch engine is blocking the mainline and here comes the Circus Train! Oh no!', 'Review', 'John Deere Heaven is a DVD in which stop-motion animation makes beloved John Deere toys come alive. Ten original songs by singer and songwriter James Coffey spice up the elaborate miniature train layouts and interactions between exquisitely accurate replicas of machines. Young and old toy collectors alike are sure to enjoy watching 1/16, 1/50, and 1/64 scale tractors, cars, and trucks vroom about in this entertaining show, especially recommended for tractor lovers. --The Midwest Book Review']
{'MPAA rating': 'G (General Audience)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.75 x 0.53 inches; 3.36 Ounces', 'Director': 'Tom McComas, Joseph Stachler', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Full Screen', 'Run time': '45 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 24, 2008', 'Actors': 'John Deere Toys & Tractors', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Studio': 'TM Books & Video', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Our Grandson "loved it".
Five Stars

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

This user demonstrates a strong preference for family-oriented entertainment, especially animated content that captivates children. Their recent interaction indicates a growing interest in comedy films, particularly those with a nostalgic flair or light-hearted themes. Although they previously focused on G-rated media, the purchase of a PG-13 title suggests a willingness to explore broader genres for family viewing, particularly if it aligns with their entertaining and playful nature.

The user values quality programming suitable for younger audiences, as highlighted by their previous engagements, while also appreciating content that can entertain adults. Their positive experience, reflected in a five-star rating, showcases an inclination towards films that evoke joy and laughter across generations. The user's interactions suggest they play a role in nurturing family dynamics, seeking out enjoyable experiences to share with younger family members, but also acknowledging the preferences of older audiences.

Overall, the user continues to favor imaginative and fun media that elicits a sense of wonder and excitement, indicating versatility in their entertainment choices while maintaining a focus on high-quality storytelling that benefits all ages.
